title: The Cage
desc: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.

title: The Man Trap
desc: Dr. McCoy discovers his old flame is not what she seems after crew members begin dying from a sudden lack of salt in their bodies.

title: Charlie X
desc: Captain Kirk must learn the limits to the power of a 17-year-old boy with the psychic ability to create anything and destroy anyone.

title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
desc: The flight recorder of the 200-year-old U.S.S. Valiant relays a tale of terror--a magnetic storm at the edge of the galaxy!

title: The Naked Time
desc: The crew is infected with a mysterious disease that removes people's emotional inhibitions to a dangerous degree.

title: The Enemy Within
desc: A transporter malfunction splits Captain Kirk into two halves: one meek and indecisive, the other violent and ill tempered. The remaining crew members stranded on the planet cannot be beamed up to the ship until a problem is fixed.

title: Mudd's Women
desc: The Enterprise picks up untrustworthy entrepreneur Harry Mudd accompanied by three beautiful women who immediately put a spell on all the male crew members.

title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
desc: Nurse Chapel is reunited with her fianc√©; but his new obsession leads him to make an android duplicate of Captain Kirk.

title: Miri
desc: The Enterprise discovers a planet exactly like Earth, but the only inhabitants are children who contract a fatal disease upon entering puberty.

title: Dagger of the Mind
desc: Kirk and psychiatrist Helen Noel are trapped on a maximum security penal colony that experiments with mind control and Spock must use the Vulcan mind-meld to find a way to save them.

title: The Corbomite Maneuver
desc: After the Enterprise is forced to destroy a dangerous marker buoy, a gigantic alien ship arrives to capture and condemn the crew as trespassers.

title: The Menagerie: Part I
desc: Spock kidnaps the crippled Capt. Pike, hijacks the Enterprise and then surrenders for court martial.

title: The Menagerie: Part II
desc: At Spock's court martial, he explains himself with mysterious footage about when Capt. Pike was kidnapped by powerful illusion casting aliens.

title: The Conscience of the King
desc: While Captain Kirk investigates whether an actor is actually a presumed dead mass murderer, a mysterious assailant is killing the people who could identify the fugitive.

title: Balance of Terror
desc: The Enterprise must decide on its response when a Romulan ship makes a destructively hostile armed probe of Federation territory.

title: Shore Leave
desc: The past three months have left the crew of the Enterprise exhausted and in desperate need of a break, but does this explain McCoy's encounter with a human-sized white rabbit or Kirk crossing paths with the prankster who plagued his days at Starfleet Academy?

title: The Galileo Seven
desc: The Galileo, under Spock's command, crash-lands on a hostile planet. As the Enterprise races against time to find the shuttlecraft, Spock's strictly logical leadership clashes with the fear and resentment of his crew.

title: The Squire of Gothos
desc: A being that controls matter and creates planets wants to play with the Enterprise crew.

title: Arena
desc: For bringing hostility into their solar system, a superior alien race brings Captain Kirk in mortal combat against the reptilian captain of an alien ship he was pursuing.

title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday
desc: The Enterprise is thrown back in time to 1960s Earth.

title: Court Martial
desc: Kirk draws a court martial in the negligent death of a crewman.

title: The Return of the Archons
desc: Seeking the answer to a century-old mystery, Kirk and crew encounter a vacantly peaceful society under a 6000-year autocratic rule that kills all those it can't absorb.

title: Space Seed
desc: While on patrol in deep space, Captain Kirk and his crew find and revive a genetically engineered world conqueror and his compatriots from Earth's 20th century.

title: A Taste of Armageddon
desc: Kirk and Spock must save their ship's crew when they are declared all killed in action in a bizarre computer simulated war where the actual deaths must occur to continue.

title: This Side of Paradise
desc: The Enterprise investigates a planet whose colonists should be dead, but are not.

title: The Devil in the Dark
desc: The Enterprise is sent to a mining colony that is being terrorized by a mysterious monster, only to find that the situation is not that simple.

title: Errand of Mercy
desc: With a war with Klingons raging, Kirk and Spock attempt to resist an occupation of a planet with incomprehensibly placid natives.

title: The Alternative Factor
desc: Existence itself comes under threat from a man's power-struggle with his alternate self, with the Enterprise's strained dilithium crystals presenting his key to a final solution.

title: The City on the Edge of Forever
desc: When a temporarily insane Dr. McCoy accidentally changes history and destroys his time, Kirk and Spock follow him to prevent the disaster, but the price to do so is high.

title: Operation - Annihilate!
desc: The Enterprise crew attempts to stop a plague of amoeba-like creatures from possessing human hosts and spreading throughout the galaxy.

title: Amok Time
desc: In the throes of his Pon Farr mating period, Spock must return to Vulcan to meet his intended future wife, betrothed from childhood.

title: Who Mourns for Adonais?
desc: A powerful being claiming to be the Greek god Apollo appears and demands that the crew of the Enterprise disembark onto his planet to worship him.

title: The Changeling
desc: A powerful artificially intelligent Earth probe, with a murderously twisted imperative, comes aboard the Enterprise and mistakes Capt. Kirk for its creator.

title: Mirror, Mirror
desc: A transporter accident places Captain Kirk's landing party in an alternate universe, where the Enterprise is in the service of a barbarically brutal empire.

title: The Apple
desc: Primitive inhabitants of Gamma Trianguli VI worship a god who orders them to kill visitors from the Enterprise.

title: The Doomsday Machine
desc: The USS Enterprise encounters the wrecked USS Constellation and its distraught commodore who's determined to stop the giant planet-destroying robot ship that killed his crew.

title: Catspaw
desc: Very alien visitors to our galaxy attempt to connect with human consciousness but miss, winding up tapping into the regions of human nightmares instead.

title: I, Mudd
desc: Harry Mudd returns with a plot to take over the Enterprise by stranding the crew on a planet populated by androids under his command.

title: Metamorphosis
desc: While returning to the Enterprise aboard the shuttlecraft, Kirk, Spock, McCoy and a seriously ill Federation diplomat find themselves kidnapped by an energized cloud.

title: Journey to Babel
desc: The Enterprise hosts a number of quarrelling diplomats, including Spock's father, but someone on board has murder in mind.

title: Friday's Child
desc: The Federation clashes with the Klingon Empire over mining rights to Capella IV. A sudden coup between its warrior-minded inhabitants forces Kirk's party to flee with the now dead leader's pregnant wife.

title: The Deadly Years
desc: A landing party from the Enterprise is exposed to strange form of radiation which rapidly ages them.

title: Obsession
desc: Capt. Kirk obsessively hunts for a mysterious cloud creature he encountered in his youth.

title: Wolf in the Fold
desc: Kirk and the Enterprise computer become detectives after Scotty is accused of murdering women on a pleasure planet.

title: The Trouble with Tribbles
desc: To protect a space station with a vital grain shipment, Kirk must deal with Federation bureaucrats, a Klingon battle cruiser and a peddler who sells furry, purring, hungry little creatures as pets.

title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
desc: Kirk, Uhura and Chekov are trapped on a planet where abducted aliens are enslaved and trained to perform as gladiators for the amusement of bored, faceless aliens.

title: A Piece of the Action
desc: The crew of the Enterprise struggles to cope with a planet of imitative people who have modeled their society on 1920s gangsters.

title: The Immunity Syndrome
desc: The Enterprise encounters a gigantic energy draining space organism that threatens the galaxy.

title: A Private Little War
desc: Peaceful, primitive peoples get caught up in the struggle between superpowers, with Kirk unhappily trying to restore the balance of power disrupted by the Klingons.

title: Return to Tomorrow
desc: The Enterprise is guided to a distant, long-dead world where survivors of an extremely ancient race - existing only as disembodied energy - desiring the bodies of Kirk, Spock and astro-biologist Ann Mulhall so that they may live again.

title: Patterns of Force
desc: Looking for a missing Federation cultural observer, Kirk and Spock find themselves on a planet whose culture has been completely patterned after Nazi Germany.

title: By Any Other Name
desc: Galactic alien scouts capture the Enterprise for a return voyage and a prelude to invasion. Kirk's one advantage - they're not used to their adopted human form.

title: The Omega Glory
desc: Responding to a distress signal, Kirk finds Captain Tracey of the U.S.S. Exeter violating the prime directive and interfering with a war between the Yangs and the Kohms to find the secret of their longevity.

title: The Ultimate Computer
desc: Kirk and a sub-skeleton crew are ordered to test out an advanced artificially intelligent control system - the M-5 Multitronic system, which could potentially render them all redundant.

title: Bread and Circuses
desc: The Enterprise crew investigates the disappearance of a ship's crew on a planet that is a modern version of the Roman Empire.

title: Assignment: Earth
desc: While back in time observing Earth in 1968, the Enterprise crew encounters the mysterious Gary Seven who has his own agenda on the planet.

title: Spock's Brain
desc: The crew of the Enterprise pursues a mysterious woman who has abducted Spock's brain.

title: The Enterprise Incident
desc: An apparently insane Capt. Kirk has the Enterprise deliberately enter the Romulan Neutral Zone where the ship is immediately captured by the enemy.

title: The Paradise Syndrome
desc: Trapped on a planet whose inhabitants are descended from Northwestern Native Americans, Kirk loses his memory and is proclaimed a God while the crippled Enterprise races back to the planet before it is destroyed by an asteroid.

title: And the Children Shall Lead
desc: The Enterprise reaches a Federation colony where the adults have all killed themselves but the children play without care.

title: Is There in Truth No Beauty?
desc: Lovely telepath Miranda is aide to Ambassador Kollos, in a box to stop insanity when humans see Medusans. She rejects Larry, a designer of Enterprise, and senses murderous intent nearby.

title: Spectre of the Gun
desc: As punishment for ignoring their warning and trespassing on their planet, the Melkot condemn Capt. Kirk and his landing party to the losing side of a surreal recreation of the 1881 historic gunfight at the OK Corral.

title: Day of the Dove
desc: Both humans and Klingons have been lured to a planet by a formless entity that feeds on hatred and has set about to fashion them into a permanent food supply for itself.

title: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
desc: The Enterprise discovers an apparent asteroid that is on a collision course with a planet is actually an ancient populated generation ship.

title: The Tholian Web
desc: With Capt. Kirk and the derelict USS Defiant apparently lost, the Enterprise grapples with an insanity causing plague and an attack by the Tholians.

title: Plato's Stepchildren
desc: After Dr. McCoy helps the leader of a planet populated by people with powerful psionic abilities, they decide to force him to stay by torturing his comrades until he submits.

title: Wink of an Eye
desc: A group of aliens who exist in a state of incredible acceleration invade the Enterprise and abduct Capt. Kirk.

title: The Empath
desc: Trapped in an alien laboratory, Kirk, Spock and McCoy meet an empath and are involved in a series of experiments.

title: Elaan of Troyius
desc: While transporting an arrogant, demanding princess for a political marriage, Captain Kirk must cope both with her biochemical ability to force him to love her, as well as sabotage on his ship.

title: Whom Gods Destroy
desc: Kirk and Spock are taken prisoners by a former starship captain named Garth, who now resides at, and has taken over, a high security asylum for the criminally insane.

title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
desc: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict.

title: The Mark of Gideon
desc: Kirk beams down to the planet Gideon and appears to find himself trapped on a deserted Enterprise. Spock on the real Enterprise must use his diplomatic skills to deal with the uncooperative inhabitants of Gideon and find the Captain.

title: That Which Survives
desc: After the Enterprise landing party beams down to investigate a geologically interesting planet, their ship is hurled across the galaxy. Kirk and company find a deserted outpost guarded by the deadly image of a beautiful woman.

title: The Lights of Zetar
desc: A mysterious, twinkling mass of sapient energy ravages an important archive and Scotty's new girlfriend may be linked to it.

title: Requiem for Methuselah
desc: On a planet, looking for an urgent medicinal cure, Kirk, Spock and McCoy come across a dignified recluse living privately but in splendor with his sheltered ward and a very protective robot servant.

title: The Way to Eden
desc: A group of idealistic hippies, led by an irrational leader, come aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.

title: The Cloud Minders
desc: Kirk and Spock are caught up in a revolution on a planet where intellectuals and artists live on a utopian city in the sky while the rest of the population toils in mines on the barren surface below.

title: The Savage Curtain
desc: Kirk, Spock, Abraham Lincoln and Vulcan legend Surak are pitted in battle against notorious villains from history for the purpose of helping a conscious rock creature's understanding of a concept he does not understand, "good vs. evil".

title: All Our Yesterdays
desc: When Kirk, Spock and McCoy investigate the disappearance of a doomed planet's population, they find themselves trapped in different periods of that world's past.

title: Turnabout Intruder
desc: Captain Kirk's insane ex-lover Dr. Janice Lester forcibly switches bodies with him in order to take command of the Enterprise.

title: Encounter at Farpoint
desc: On the maiden mission of the U.S.S. Enterprise (NCC-1701-D), an omnipotent being known as Q challenges the crew to discover the secret of a mysterious base in an advanced and civilized fashion.

title: The Naked Now
desc: The crew of the Enterprise is infected with a virus that causes them to behave as though they were intoxicated.

title: Code of Honor
desc: When the leader of an alien culture takes a romantic interest in Lt. Yar, he claims her for his own, to the dismay of his own wife, who, in turn, challenges Tasha in a fight to the death.

title: The Last Outpost
desc: The Enterprise makes a confrontational first contact with the piratical Ferengi race as their two ships are ensnared by a presumed dead planet ready to judge them.

title: Where No One Has Gone Before
desc: Everyone accurately pegs a visiting propulsion scientist as a charlatan, but only Wesley Crusher recognizes his alien assistant as the real deal.

title: Lonely Among Us
desc: While distracted by two antithetical races applying for Federation membership, the Enterprise picks up a sentient entity that can alternately possess either man or machinery.

title: Justice
desc: On an alien planet, young Wesley Crusher commits a transgression - small by our standards but mandatorily punishable by death in theirs.

title: The Battle
desc: Beware Ferengi bearing gifts. Capt. Picard receives the Stargazer, a ship considered lost that he once commanded.

title: Hide And Q
desc: The Enterprise encounters Q again, and he tempts Riker by endowing him with the powers of the Q.

title: Haven
desc: While on a mission to a planet called Haven, Counselor Troi meets her husband to be, a marriage arranged by her father years before, as the Enterprise encounters a ship far deadlier than any combat could provide.

title: The Big Goodbye
desc: Captain Picard and some of his crew are caught in a deadly trap in the holodeck as the result of a ship-wide scan from an alien race.

title: Datalore
desc: The Enterprise visits the planet where Data was created and discovers another android like him, but when he's assembled, he's not exactly like him.

title: Angel One
desc: Riker, Troi, Data and Yar beam down to a planet ruled by a matriarchal government in the hopes of locating a missing freighter crew.
The Enterprise docks at a starbase for repairs where it is commandeered by a race of technologically-linked aliens intent on using the vessel for their own purposes.

title: Too Short A Season
desc: The Enterprise transports an elderly Starfleet Admiral to negotiate a hostage crisis. When the Admiral takes a de-aging drug, he endangers both his life and the mission.

title: When The Bough Breaks
desc: A planet that was able to cloak itself for thousands of years suddenly reveals itself, with its inhabitants proposing peace. But, after initial negotiations, children of the Enterprise are kidnapped due to the infertility of the inhabitants.

title: Home Soil
desc: On Velara III, Geordi and Data discover a microscopic life form responsible for the death of an engineer stationed on the base.

title: Coming of Age
desc: Picard finds himself facing a strenuous test of his loyalty to Starfleet, one which the other members of the crew are struggling to cope with, whilst Wesley faces an equally challenging entrance exam at Starfleet Academy.

title: Heart of Glory
desc: The Enterprise searches for answers as to why three Klingon warriors were the only survivors aboard a freighter just inside the Neutral Zone which was seemingly attacked by a Ferengi ship.

title: The Arsenal of Freedom
desc: The Enterprise encounters a planet long dead, but technical equipment still functions for the purpose of selling off its arsenal, along with self sufficiency.

title: Symbiosis
desc: The Enterprise encounters two neighboring cultures, one suffering from a plague, the other marketing a cure, and learns that nothing is as simple as it seems.

title: Skin Of Evil
desc: Counselor Troi is held captive on a deserted planet by a slick, black, oily, sentient and immortal puddle of evil.

title: We'll Always Have Paris
desc: A scientist's experiment in time goes awry, reuniting Picard with an old flame, now married to the scientist.

title: Conspiracy
desc: After diverting to a secret meeting with an old friend and some of Starfleet's finest commanders, Picard finds the Horatio blown to bits just hours after the meeting and he returns the Enterprise to Earth looking for answers.

title: The Neutral Zone
desc: While assigned to investigate missing outposts in the Neutral Zone, the Enterprise revives three cryogenically frozen people found aboard a wayward derelict Earth vessel.

title: The Child
desc: Deanna is impregnated by a unknown alien life-form, and Dr. Katherine Pulaski joins the Enterprise as the ship's new Chief Medical Officer.

title: Where Silence Has Lease
desc: The Enterprise encounters a mysterious void in space and when they move in closer to investigate further, it envelops them and they can't get out.

title: Elementary, Dear Data
desc: An attempt to provide Data with a challenging Sherlock Holmes holodeck RPG scenario backfires when its Prof. Moriarty character accidentally becomes self-aware.

title: The Outrageous Okona
desc: The Enterprise rescues the captain of a broken-down freighter, only to become involved in a dispute between feuding worlds--each demanding custody of their guest. Data seeks help from Guinan in understanding humor.

title: Loud As A Whisper
desc: The crew ferries a deaf mediator to Solais V to negotiate an end to a civil war.

title: The Schizoid Man
desc: A dying anti-social scientist unintentionally comes upon the perfect vessel in which to preserve his intellect and arrogant personality - Data.

title: Unnatural Selection
desc: Enhanced DNA developments trigger an epidemic of rapid aging. Caught among its victims - Dr. Pulaski.

title: A Matter Of Honor
desc: Under an Officers Exchange Program, Riker serves aboard a Klingon ship, whose aging captain seeks an unwarranted bloody retaliation for suspected Enterprise treachery.

title: The Measure of a Man
desc: When Data resigns his commission rather than be dismantled for examination by an inadequately skilled scientist, a formal hearing is convened to determine whether Data is considered property without rights or is a sentient being.

title: The Dauphin
desc: Wesley falls for the young future leader of Daled IV, unaware just how dangerous the girl's protective and overly restrictive guardian can be.

title: Contagion
desc: Encountering the superior technology of a very ancient race creates system malfunctions for a doomed Federation starship, for the Enterprise, and for an eavesdropping Romulan warbird.

title: The Royale
desc: Worf, Data and Riker find themselves trapped in a recreation of a poorly written novel.

title: Time Squared
desc: The Enterprise comes across its own shuttlecraft adrift in space - a duplicate - with an unconscious duplicate Capt. Picard inside.

title: The Icarus Factor
desc: Riker's delight at being offered a command of the USS Aries turns to frustration when the man sent to prepare him for his mission is his estranged father; Worf's behavior leads Wesley to delve into Klingon tradition.

title: Pen Pals
desc: Data befriends an alien girl in distress, breaking the Prime Directive, while Wesley commands his first team.

title: Q Who
desc: Q tries to prove that Picard needs him as part of their crew by hurling the Enterprise 7,000 light years away where they encounter the Borg for the first time.

title: Samaritan Snare
desc: With Picard away for routine surgery, the Enterprise responds to an apparent distress call from a Pakled vessel.

title: Up The Long Ladder
desc: An antiquated distress signal leads to two lost 22nd century Earth colonies, each facing doom in different ways, one by fire, the other by prolonged cloning.

title: Manhunt
desc: A midlife Betazoid condition renders Ambassador Troi hot on the hunt for romance and wedlock with Captain Picard - or any man.

title: The Emissary
desc: The Enterprise addresses the emergency of an old Klingon ship coming out of stasis and ready to fight the Federation. A half-Human/half Klingon emissary arrives to help, who once knew Worf intimately.

title: Peak Performance
desc: The crew of the Enterprise participates in war games.

title: Shades of Gray
desc: When Commander Riker comes down with a dangerous alien infection after an away mission, the only way to treat it may be through reliving his memories.

title: Evolution
desc: Wesley's latest science project escapes the lab, threatening the Enterprise and an eminent scientist's life-long project.

title: The Ensigns of Command
desc: After 111 years of silence, an extremely litigious alien race asserts its agreed upon right to wipe out a Federation colony in its territory.

title: The Survivors
desc: The Enterprise responds to a distress call from Rana IV, a Federation colony that is under attack from an unknown alien ship. When they arrive, they find the entire surface of the planet destroyed, save for a single house and two occupants.

title: Who Watches The Watchers
desc: A proto-Vulcan culture worships Captain Picard and prepares to offer Counselor Troi as a sacrifice.

title: The Bonding
desc: A startling surprise awaits the crew of the Enterprise when a mission costs the life of a crew member, who left her son behind.

title: Booby Trap
desc: The Enterprise triggers an ancient yet effective trap left by an extinct race, with a perfectly preserved derelict ship serving as cheese for Picard.

title: The Enemy
desc: La Forge gets left behind on a storm-plagued planet when the rest of his team encounters a Romulan warrior.

title: The Price
desc: While the Enterprise hosts negotiations for control of a stable wormhole, Troi forms a personal relationship with an opposing negotiator, unaware of his true being.

title: The Vengeance Factor
desc: The Enterprise pursues a race of "gatherers" who continue to raid Federation outposts, unaware of the dangers lurking among them.

title: The Defector
desc: When a Romulan officer defects to the Federation with a warning of a impending invasion, Capt. Picard struggles to decide if he is to be believed.

title: The Hunted
desc: Investigating a planet applying for membership into the Federation, the crew of the Enterprise finds a group of inhabitants who used to be soldiers, but now fight for their very existence.

title: The High Ground
desc: While visiting a planet under civil war, Dr. Crusher is taken hostage by an opposing faction of the planet's ruling government.

title: Deja Q
desc: Much to Picard's displeasure, Q reappears on the Enterprise, claiming to have been ejected from the Q Continuum, and therefore, lost his powers.

title: A Matter of Perspective
desc: The widow of respected scientist Dr. Nel Apgar accuses Riker of seducing her and killing her husband. Rather than turn Riker over for unfavorable trial, the Enterprise reconstructs the facts.

title: Yesterday's Enterprise
desc: The Enterprise C enters the Enterprise D's time and space continuum, where they find Picard and crew in a constant state of war with the Klingons, and only Guinan knows it.

title: The Offspring
desc: After returning from a cybernetics conference to the Enterprise, Data creates his own "child," much to the chagrin of his captain, and without regards to the ramifications with Starfleet.

title: Sins of The Father
desc: A Klingon commander comes aboard the Enterprise in an officer exchange program initiated by Starfleet, much to the chagrin of the crew.

title: Allegiance
desc: Picard is kidnapped and held with three different aliens and meanwhile replaced with a replica as impostor captain.

title: Captain's Holiday
desc: After mediating a difficult trade agreement, Captain Picard is encouraged to take a much needed rest on a vacationing planet, where he's visited by a strange race from the future, in search of a dangerous weapon.

title: Tin Man
desc: The Enterprise reaches out to an alien being, while dancing around with the Romulans, who want to attack it in an act of vengeance.

title: Hollow Pursuits
desc: A shy member of the "Enterprise" crew becomes addicted to the holodeck, where relationships are easier than in real life, when his knowledge is needed in engineering.

title: The Most Toys
desc: When transporting a dangerous material to the Enterprise, Data is kidnapped and the crew is led to believe he is dead when the shuttlecraft he was piloting explodes enroute.

title: Sarek
desc: Legendary Federation ambassador Sarek visits the Enterprise to conclude peace talks with a race called the Legarans. His arrival is accompanied with a rash of unusual emotional outbursts among the crew.

title: M√©nage √† Troi
desc: When Deanna's mother spurns advances made by a Ferengi Daimon, he takes it upon himself to kidnap the two of them, along with Commander Riker and steal them away aboard his ship.

title: Transfigurations
desc: The Enterprise finds a deserted planet where a ship has crashed, and, with it, the lone survivor with no memory, but extraordinary healing powers.

title: The Best of Both Worlds
desc: Responding to a distress call on one of the Federation's outer-most colonies, the Enterprise arrives...only to find a big hole in the ground where the town used to be, and discovers the Borg are behind the attack.

title: The Best of Both Worlds Part II
desc: Having absorbed Captain Picard and his knowledge, the Borg head for Earth, leaving Riker and the Enterprise desperate for an unanticipated way to defeat them.

title: Family
desc: After defeating the Borg, the crew of the Enterprise experiences shore leave in various ways. Captain Picard's return to his family's vineyard in France has some extraordinary repercussions.

title: Brothers
desc: After an accident aboard the Enterprise leaves one of its children in grave danger, Data commandeers the Enterprise, driven to take the ship to an unknown origin, where an interesting figure awaits.

title: Suddenly Human
desc: On a rescue mission to an alien shipwrecked training mission, they discover one of its trainees to be a human.

title: Remember Me
desc: Dr. Crusher's fear of losing loved ones becomes real when her worries create an alternate reality.

title: Legacy
desc: The crew of the Enterprise enters into orbit around the home planet of their former crewmate, Tasha Yar, where they encounter her sister.

title: Reunion
desc: When the leader of the Klingon High Council passes on, Picard finds himself in the middle of the struggle for the now-vacant position. Meanwhile, Worf reunites with a past love, only to find he now has a son.

title: Future Imperfect
desc: Riker awakens sixteen years after an away mission where he contracted a disease which destroyed his memory back to the point of infection - or so he's told.

title: Final Mission
desc: Before leaving for Starfleet Academy, Wesley Crusher accompanies Captain Picard on a dangerous mission.

title: The Loss
desc: As an unknown force drags the Enterprise, Deanna Troi struggles with the loss of her empathic abilities.

title: Data's Day
desc: Data tries to comprehend the complex emotions between O'Brien and Keiko, who are about to be married.

title: The Wounded
desc: After being fired upon by a Cardassian vessel, Picard races against time to find out the facts behind the Cardassian commander's claim that the Federation attacked one of their outposts.

title: Devil's Due
desc: While answering a distress call, Picard finds himself not sure of exactly who he is dealing with, but he's sure he's not dealing with the planet's version of the Devil, as she claims to be.

title: Clues
desc: Effects of passing through a wormhole give the Enterprise crew a sense that they were unconscious for more than the thirty seconds they've been led to believe.

title: First Contact
desc: Disguised as an alien prior to First Contact, Will's life becomes imperiled when incurred injuries reveal his foreign internal structure to a xenophobic alien population.

title: Galaxy's Child
desc: As Geordi La Forge finally meets the real Dr. Leah Brahms, a tragic first contact leaves the Enterprise with a gigantic galactic infant suckling the ship's energy.

title: Night Terrors
desc: The Enterprise gets trapped in a Tyken's Rift, an energy-absorbing rupture in space, where all but Data, Troi and Guinan experience rising hallucinations and paranoia.

title: Identity Crisis
desc: Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge and an old friend fight to defeat a parasite that is trying to transform them into another species.

title: The Nth Degree
desc: When assigned to investigate an unknown probe, Lt. Barclay is electrocuted through a shuttlecraft's computer, where he receives an unexplainable boost of confidence and a vast increase in his knowledge.

title: Qpid
desc: Aiming to get out of Jean-Luc's debt, Q forces Capt. Picard and his officers to live out the Legend of Robin Hood - with a past acquaintance as Maid Marian.

title: The Drumhead
desc: A retired admiral boards the Enterprise in an effort to determine the actions aboard the ship surrounding an act of sabotage and possible treason.

title: Half a Life
desc: Counselor Troi's mother visits the Enterprise and becomes infatuated with a man whose culture forces him into a suicidal ritual called "The Resolution."

title: The Host
desc: Dr. Crusher falls for someone who's not at all what she expects him to be.

title: The Mind's Eye
desc: Geordi is brainwashed by the Romulans to start a war between the Klingons and the Federation

title: In Theory
desc: When a female crew member is infatuated with Lieutenant Commander Data, he decides to give a romantic relationship a try. Also, the Enterprise finds itself having to maneuver through a dangerous nebula.

title: Redemption
desc: Both Captain Picard and Lt. Worf must decide where their priorities lie as the Klingon Empire descends into a bitter civil war.

title: Redemption II
desc: As Worf fights in the Klingon Civil War, Captain Picard and his crew must stop the Romulans from helping their pawns achieve victory.

title: Darmok
desc: Picard must learn to communicate with a race that speaks in metaphor under a difficult set of circumstances.

title: Ensign Ro
desc: Captain Picard foils a plot against the Bajorans with his new Bajoran officer, Ensign Ro.

title: Silicon Avatar
desc: The Crystalline Entity returns, and the Enterprise takes aboard a scientist to help track it down, but her personal agenda does not match Capt. Picard's.

title: Disaster
desc: Collision with a quantum filament leaves Troi in charge of a damaged and endangered Enterprise with emergency bulkheads cutting off sections of the ship.

title: The Game
desc: Wesley Crusher returns to the Enterprise on vacation from the Academy only to discover a mysterious alien game infiltrating and controlling the crew.

title: Unification I
desc: Picard and Data follow Spock into Romulan space on a dangerous mission.

title: Unification II
desc: On Romulus, Picard finds Spock, as well as an underground peace movement, a double agent, a bold ulterior motive against the Federation, and a familiar foe.

title: A Matter Of Time
desc: Reaching Penthara IV after an asteroid wreaks havoc of catastrophic proportions, the Enterprise crew deals with trying to save the planet as well as deal with someone who claims to be a historian from the future.

title: New Ground
desc: Geordi can barely curtail his enthusiasm at being able to test out a new theory of transportation, as Worf's mother boards the Enterprise with his son and news that Worf's Earthly parents can no longer care for him.

title: Hero Worship
desc: Data rescues an orphaned boy named Timothy from a damaged ship. As a way to repress his own pain, Timothy begins to mimic Data's personality.

title: Violations
desc: Transporting three Ullian mind-probing historians, the Enterprise crew is stymied when some of its members fall into a coma. Deanna Troi, the first crew member to come through it, cannot recall anything surrounding the incident.

title: The Masterpiece Society
desc: Working together to prevent the annihilation of a perfectly balanced, isolated society (with no contingency for outside visitors) may, in fact, destroy it.

title: Conundrum
desc: When an approaching alien ship wipes their memory, the crew struggles to put back together what happened.

title: Power Play
desc: A long-lost ship is found on a planet where cosmic storms prevented detection for 200 years. When a surface landing goes wrong, the away team is beamed back...with a few extra surprises.

title: Ethics
desc: After an accident that leaves him no longer able to walk, Worf asks Riker to help him commit suicide.

title: The Outcast
desc: While aiding an androgynous race who lost a couple of members in an unmapped region of space, Riker falls for one of them, which can lead to trouble if detected, since the alien race does not endorse gender specificity.

title: Cause And Effect
desc: The Enterprise gets caught in a time loop which always has one result: total destruction of the ship, itself.

title: The First Duty
desc: Wesley Crusher's team has an accident at Starfleet Academy. Picard offers to help a Starfleet investigation as to what happened, and begins to suspect they are hiding something.

title: Cost Of Living
desc: As undetectable parasites devour the ship, Deanna's mother arrives, taking young Alexander under her wing en route to meeting a man she's blindly agreed to marry.

title: The Perfect Mate
desc: Ferengi machinations unleash a diplomatic gift aboard the Enterprise - the rare, empathic perfect mate, ready to bond with any male around her.

title: Imaginary Friend
desc: A powerful, potentially dangerous energy life form, intent on scouting out the Enterprise, steps into the role of a girl's imaginary friend.

title: I Borg
desc: The Enterprise finds a lone Borg drone, separated from the collective, and brings him aboard. The drone begins to reassert his individuality, but his presence causes differing levels of fear and sympathy from various crew members.

title: The Next Phase
desc: A transporter malfunction, combined with a Romulan ship under stress and a damaged cloaking device, creates the illusion that Ensign Ro and Geordi are dead, but Geordi doesn't believe it to be so, and he acts accordingly.

title: The Inner Light
desc: Picard awakes to find himself living in a small village where he is a well-known member of the community who is suffering from a delusion of being a starship captain.

title: Time's Arrow
desc: Captain Picard and his archaeological curiosity are called upon by scientists from Earth when they find evidence to support beliefs that aliens had visited Earth in the late 1800s.

title: Time's Arrow, Part II
desc: Captain Picard and crew follow Data back to the late 1800s to get him back, only to find the suspected alien visitors killing people of that time.

title: Realm Of Fear
desc: Overcoming his fear of transporter, Lt. Barclay joins an away team, only to find something in the beam with him.

title: Man Of The People
desc: When the Enterprise comes to the rescue of an ambassador and his "mother", Deanna finds herself attracted to him, and seeks to comfort him upon her death.

title: Relics
desc: The Enterprise stumbles upon a Dyson sphere, with a ship crashed on the outer surface. An away team finds some systems still powered up and the chief engineer from the old Enterprise, Montgomery Scott, locked in the transporter cycle.

title: Schisms
desc: Commander Riker's inability to fall asleep begins to show in other members of the crew in other forms, putting the Enterprise on the trail of a mystery.

title: True Q
desc: When an honor student in the medical field is assigned to the Enterprise in an internship manner, she begins to demonstrate powers of the Q, prompting you-know-who to show up.

title: Rascals
desc: An emergency beam out renders four crewmen down to childhood shortly before renegade Ferengi take over the Enterprise and offload the adults.

title: A Fistful of Datas
desc: While the crew is experiencing some much needed down time, Worf and his son go on an Old West excursion in the holodeck, where they meet several versions of Data serving as the bad guy after an experiment in Engineering goes wrong.

title: The Quality of Life
desc: When Geordi is assigned to survey a new mining development with Dr. Farallon, who invented an experimental mining technology, she uses a new sophisticated robot called an Exocomp to repair a power grid.

title: Chain Of Command, Part I
desc: Picard is replaced as captain of the Enterprise so he, Lt. Worf and Dr. Crusher go on a top-secret mission into Cardassian space. Meanwhile, his replacement, Captain Jellico, meets his new command with some resistance from the crew.

title: Chain Of Command, Part II
desc: While the humorless Captain Jellico leads the effort to prevent a Cardassian invasion, Picard is captured and tortured by a ruthless interrogator in an attempt to break him.

title: Ship In A Bottle
desc: Lt. Barclay mistakenly awakes Moriarty in the forgotten holodeck program, who then makes his demands clear and unforgettable.

title: Aquiel
desc: Murderous intrigue abounds for the Enterprise when one of the crew aboard a subspace station is believed dead, and suspected to have taken part in it until the Klingons show up with the young lieutenant, to Geordi's taste.

title: Face Of The Enemy
desc: Deanna awakes to find herself altered to look like a Romulan, immediately unaware she's involved in a cat-and-mouse game as a member of their intelligence agency.

title: Tapestry
desc: When Captain Picard's artificial heart fails, he is offered the rare opportunity to go back in time and set right the mistake that led to his demise.

title: Birthright, Part I
desc: While visiting Deep Space 9, a Yridian tells Worf his father lives, and a discharge from an alien device puts Data in a dream state where he meets his own father.

title: Birthright, Part II
desc: In seeking his father, Worf discovers a prisoner-of-war camp that has evolved into a Klingon/Romulan haven - an Eden where Worf becomes their serpent.

title: Starship Mine
desc: When the Enterprise puts in to space dock for an energy sweep of the ship which is lethal to humans, Picard gets trapped on board with technicians who are not what they appear to be.

title: Lessons
desc: Picard falls for the new head of the stellar science services department, but has feelings of misgivings when he's forced to assign her to a dangerous mission.

title: The Chase
desc: The crew of the Enterprise must race against various rival powers to uncover an archaeological secret that explains the predominance of humanoid life forms in the galaxy.

title: Frame of Mind
desc: Riker begins to question reality when he finds himself in an alien insane asylum and faces the prospect his life on the Enterprise has been a delusion.

title: Suspicions
desc: Dr. Crusher puts her career on the line to prove a scientist's theoretical new shielding technology which may have cost him his life.

title: Rightful Heir
desc: During Worf's crisis of faith on Boreth, Kahless the Unforgettable makes his promised legendary return, but Klingon leader Gowron challenges his authenticity.

title: Second Chances
desc: Riker's exact duplicate is discovered on Nervala IV. His first order of business: resume his relationship with Deanna. Second order: obey orders from his superior - himself.

title: Timescape
desc: Aboard a shuttlecraft and en route back to the Enterprise, Picard, LaForge, Data, and Troi find themselves trapped in a time trap of some sort, where the Enterprise is being taken over by Romulans, and the ship, itself, on a course of destruction.

title: Descent
desc: After an encounter with the Borg, Data feels his first emotion when he gets angry with the Borg. Data then tries to find ways to recreate the situation in order to feel emotions again, whilst the Enterprise investigates the Borg activity, and are bewildered as to why they feel emotions too.

title: Descent, Part II
desc: Before Lore can run risky experiments on Geordi, Troi and Picard, the three seek a way to re-boot Data's ethical program that Lore switched off to pull Data to his side.

title: Liaisons
desc: On a diplomatic mission, Worf, Troi and the Captain deal with three aliens who explore foreign concepts with extreme, singular focus.

title: Interface
desc: Geordi is distracted by the news of the possible loss of his mother while he uses a new remote probe technology to search for a downed spacecraft.

title: Gambit, Part I
desc: While investigating the apparent death of Capt. Picard, Riker is abducted by a group of intergalactic archaeological thieves, only to find Picard has apparently joined their ranks.

title: Gambit, Part II
desc: Riker and Picard must find out why this intergalactic gang is looting archaeological sites.

title: Phantasms
desc: Data deals with his new ability to experience nightmares as the Enterprise deals with the installation of a new warp core that won't work as expected.

title: Dark Page
desc: While establishing diplomatic relations with an alien race called the Cairn, Deanna's mother experiences a mental breakdown and falls into a coma, and it seems like Deanna is the only one who is able to help her, even if her mother doesn't want it.

title: Attached
desc: Captain Picard and Dr. Crusher discover things about one another when they are captured by an opposing alien race, due to the fact that the Enterprise has come to allow the planet's other civilization the choice of being part of the Federation.

title: Force of Nature
desc: While searching for a missing Federation medical transport, the Enterprise is accosted by two scientists from a nearby planet who claim that cumulative exposure to warp energy is weakening the fabric of space.

title: Inheritance
desc: On Federation planet Atrea IV, Data encounters the former wife of his creator Noonian Soong who claims to be his "mother".

title: Parallels
desc: On his return from a bat'leth competition in the Klingon Empire, Worf finds himself shifting realities where events and details are in a constant state of flux and only he is aware of the changes.

title: The Pegasus
desc: Riker finds out his former commander from the starship Pegasus has orders that entail more than what is revealed to Picard, who thinks the Enterprise is en route to recover the lost ship. And Riker is ordered to secrecy.

title: Homeward
desc: In an attempt to preserve a race of people on a planet being bombarded by storms that would kill them, Worf's foster brother violates the Prime Directive, leaving the Enterprise crew in a difficult position.

title: Sub Rosa
desc: Dr. Crusher meets the man in her dead grandmother's life when she tries to put her affairs in order, whom one of the local people warn her to stay away from by not lighting a candle that has been lit for generations.

title: Lower Decks
desc: A mission of the Enterprise is seen through the eyes of some junior officers who are up for promotions, as questions of duty and honor arise among some of them, such as a Bajoran whom Worf has designated to be promoted to operations.

title: Thine Own Self
desc: Data is sent to follow a probe that has drifted off course and crashed on a primitive planet, only to crash on the planet himself, with no memory of any event prior to crashing on the planet's surface.

title: Masks
desc: Investigating a rogue comet that's been traveling throughout the universe for over 87 million years, Picard discovers alien beings within the comet, which infest the computer systems on the Enterprise, as well as Data.

title: Eye of the Beholder
desc: As a young lieutenant aboard the Enterprise commits suicide, his shipmates deal with the loss and Deanna deals with feelings surrounding her as she and Worf begin to form a relationship.

title: Genesis
desc: When a new torpedo guidance system malfunctions, Picard and Data go chasing after it into an asteroid field, while the crew is left behind to deal with their own strange behaviors.

title: Journey's End
desc: After the Federation grants access by the Cardassians to a planet already inhabited by Native American Indians, Picard has the daunting task of relocating them.

title: Firstborn
desc: In an effort to help him accept his Klingon heritage, Worf and his son, Alexander, attend an ancient Klingon ceremony.

title: Bloodlines
desc: Picard races the Ferengi in an effort to track down the son he never knew he had.

title: Emergence
desc: Strange images begin appearing throughout the ship's decks and holodecks. Data and the rest of the crew begin to investigate only to discover that the ship's computer itself is exhibiting the strange behavior as it begins to become self-aware.

title: Preemptive Strike
desc: Following her return from Advanced Tactical Training, Bajoran Ro Laren is sent to infiltrate the Maquis and finds herself torn between her loyalty to Picard and Starfleet, and her sympathy with the Maquis fighting "the good fight".

title: Star Trek: The Next Generation-All Good Things, Part I
desc: Capt. Picard finds himself shifting continually into the past, future and present and must use that to discover a threat to humanity's existence.

title: Emissary
desc: When the troubled Commander Sisko takes command of a surrendered space station, he learns that it borders a unique stable wormhole.

title: Past Prologue
desc: Tahna Los, a former Bajoran terrorist during the Occupation, asks Sisko for asylum on DS9. Meanwhile, the station's last Cardassian inhabitant, Garak, possibly a former spy for the Cardassian government, proves an interesting mystery to Dr. Bashir.

title: A Man Alone
desc: Ibudan, a criminal Odo has dealt with before, returns to DS9 only to be murdered shortly after - leaving Odo to be the prime suspect. Jake and Nog's trouble-making prompt Keiko to do something helpful for the station's children.

title: Babel
desc: The crew and civilian population of Deep Space Nine begin to speak gibberish when a plague - an 'aphasia virus' - engineered by the Bajorans as a weapon against the Cardassians, accidentally gets released into the station's atmosphere.

title: Captive Pursuit
desc: For the first time an alien comes from the other side of the wormhole. He has ship trouble and seems very reluctant to accept any help. Chief O'Brien quickly finds out he has a secret.

title: Q-Less
desc: Q, the Enterprise-D's consistent omnipotent annoyance, comes to harass the DS9 crew when his traveling companion, Vash, refuses to travel with Q any longer.

title: Dax
desc: Jadzia Dax is accused of a murder that her previous host, Curzon, supposedly committed.

title: The Passenger
desc: Rao Vantika, a captured criminal, is badly burned and dies in Bashir's arms but the criminal's captor believes that he is still alive.

title: Move along Home
desc: The Wadi from the Gamma Quadrant visit DS9, thereby making first contact with the Federation. When they catch Quark cheating, they let him off by playing a special game.

title: The Nagus
desc: The Ferengi leader, Grand Nagus Zek, comes to the station. He seems very interested in Quark's bar.

title: Vortex
desc: A man named Croden tells Odo he can take him to a place where aliens much like Odo himself exist, which would help Odo find out where he truly comes from.

title: Battle Lines
desc: After showing Bajoran spiritual leader Kai Opaka the wormhole, she, Sisko, Bashir and Kira crash land on a moon. Kai Opaka dies and the three meet the unfriendly locals.

title: The Storyteller
desc: While Sisko tries to negotiate an agreement between two Bajoran factions, he orders O'Brien to escort Bashir to investigate an emergency that endangers a village.

title: Progress
desc: Kira must convince an old Bajoran farmer to leave a moon becoming uninhabitable due to mining operations. Jake and Nog try to trade off Cardassian yamok sauce.

title: If Wishes Were Horses
desc: While Dax investigates an unusual energy reading near DS9 to see if it's dangerous for the station, people's imaginations suddenly come alive, causing chaos.

title: The Forsaken
desc: Lwaxana Troi comes for a political visit and instead hounds Odo for romantic attention. Meanwhile, an alien probe wreaks havoc with the station's computer, leaving Odo and Lwaxana trapped together.

title: Dramatis Personae
desc: The entire station's command staff, save Odo, become power hungry and vie to defeat each other by forming secret alliances and plotting assassinations. Odo tries to figure out the cause of this mysterious behavior.

title: Duet
desc: A Cardassian suffering from Kalla-Nohra, a disease that indicates he served in a labor camp, visits DS9. Kira is determined to convict him as a war criminal.

title: In the Hands of the Prophets
desc: Vedek Winn, a candidate in the race for the open Kai position, stirs up trouble on DS9 when she attempts to boycott Keiko's school for not teaching Bajoran religious beliefs.

title: The Homecoming
desc: Word that a previously thought dead Bajoran resistance legend is still alive sends Kira and Chief O'Brien to Cardassia IV to rescue him; meanwhile "The Circle", a sect of the Bajoran provisional government that is intent on wiping out alien influence, is sneaking into power.

title: The Circle
desc: Kira spends time with Vedek Bareil on Bajor just as the Circle begins receiving arms from an unknown source.

title: The Siege
desc: As a Circle-led Bajoran military attempts to occupy the station, a skeleton crew, led by Sisko fight to reveal the Circle's secret before they're forced to evacuate themselves. Meanwhile, Kira and Dax lead a mission to reveal the truth about the Circle, on Bajor.

title: Invasive Procedures
desc: A jealous Trill, who had waited his entire life to receive a symbiont but never did, decides to steal Dax's.

title: Cardassians
desc: Political tensions rise on DS9 when Bajorans board the station with a supposedly orphaned Cardassian whom they have adopted.

title: Melora
desc: Melora Pazlar, a new arrival on DS9 with a special gravity-based disability, finds an admirer in Bashir. Meanwhile, an old associate of Quark's comes to the station to kill the bartender.

title: Rules of Acquisition
desc: A female Ferengi named Pel, posing as a male so that she can engage in business, falls for Quark during very important negotiations between the Ferengi and a Gamma Quadrant race.

title: Necessary Evil
desc: Odo relives some terrible and tragic memories of a past investigation when he was the constable on Cardassian-occupied Deep Space Nine, then named Terok Nor.

title: Second Sight
desc: While noted scientist Gideon Seyetik is preparing for an ambitious project, re-igniting a star, Sisko is intrigued by a woman who keeps disappearing.

title: Sanctuary
desc: A race that has been conquered twice over, one of the conquerors being the mysterious Dominion, comes to the station seeking aid and a new home.

title: Rivals
desc: Quark meets his match when a new rival opens a casino opposite his bar on the Promenade. Meanwhile, the station is suffering issues of high improbability.

title: The Alternate
desc: Odo and his mentor Dr. Mora Pol discover a lifeform similar to Odo on a Gamma Quadrant planet.

title: Armageddon Game
desc: Chief O'Brien, who still doesn't particularly like Doctor Bashir, must rely on him when the two are stranded on a planet and O'Brien is infected with a deadly, fast moving disease.

title: Whispers
desc: Chief O'Brien's world is turned upside down when for no reason whatsoever he is being ignored by his family and friends and is being closed out of every essential job on the station.

title: Paradise
desc: Sisko and Chief O'Brien discover a colony which lives without technology.

title: Shadowplay
desc: Odo and Dax investigate the mysterious disappearance of people from a village. Kira tries to keep a close eye on Quark, while Vedek Bareil unexpectedly visits.

title: Playing God
desc: A Trill named Arjin comes to DS9 to learn what it is to be a Trill with a symbiont but finds his teacher, Dax, to be less than he expected.

title: Profit and Loss
desc: A Cardassian woman named Natima Lang, who was once a flame of Quark's, visits the station under dubious circumstances.

title: Blood Oath
desc: Three legendary Klingons come to DS9 to see if Jadzia will participate in a blood oath that they made with Dax's previous host Curzon.

title: The Maquis, Part I
desc: The destruction of a Cardassian ship leads Sisko, Dukat, and Sisko's old friend Cal Hudson to the fact that there is an unofficial war between the Maquis and the Cardassians.

title: The Maquis, Part II
desc: Sisko tries to resolve the Maquis crisis by preventing a war, freeing Gul Dukat and offering the defected Hudson the chance to return.

title: The Wire
desc: Dr. Bashir fights to save Garak's life when a device implanted in his brain, designed to alleviate pain in the event of torture, begins to malfunction and is slowly killing him.

title: Crossover
desc: Kira and Bashir find themselves in an alternate universe.

title: The Collaborator
desc: Vedek Bareil's targeted by fellow Kai candidate, Vedek Winn as having been a collaborator with the Cardassians during the Occupation.

title: Tribunal
desc: Chief O'Brien goes through the horrific Cardassian judicial system when he is charged for an unknown crime.

title: The Jem'Hadar
desc: While in the Gamma Quadrant, Sisko, Quark and a strange telepathic woman are captured by the Jem'Hadar, the soldiers of the Dominion.

title: The Search, Part I
desc: Instead of waiting for the Jem'Hadar to attack, Sisko wants to try a different tactic; he wants to take a new class starship to try to find the Founders.

title: The Search, Part II
desc: Odo has found his home and is introduced. Meanwhile Sisko finds out peace talks between the Dominion and the Federation have already started.

title: The House of Quark
desc: Quark is forced to marry a Klingon widow after he takes credit for the accidental death of her husband, the head of a powerful Klingon House.

title: Equilibrium
desc: The Trill homeworld is the setting, as Sisko and Bashir take Jadzia home for treatment when she begins experiencing hallucinations after playing a tune she can't recall.

title: Second Skin
desc: Kira finds herself on Cardassia as a Cardassian. She is told she is called Iliana Ghemor and was a Cardassian spy.

title: The Abandoned
desc: Odo tries to change the nature of a rapidly maturing Jem'Hadar infant, Quark finds, whilst Sisko tries to break his son's relationship with a 20 year old Dabo girl.

title: Civil Defense
desc: The station goes into lockdown and the crew is endangered when an old Cardassian security program is accidentally activated.

title: Meridian
desc: Dax falls in love with one of the residents of a multi-dimensional planet, while on DS9 an alien requests a holosuite program of Kira from Quark.

title: Defiant
desc: Riker arrives on the station to requisition the Defiant in order to fight with the Maquis. Sisko assists Gul Dukat on Cardassia Prime to prevent the ship from entering Cardassian territory.

title: Fascination
desc: When Lwaxana Troi visits the station for the Bajoran Gratitude Festival, the crew is stricken with intense romantic attractions to one another.

title: Past Tense, Part I
desc: Sisko, Bashir and Dax are accidentally sent to San Francisco in the 21st century due to a transporter malfunction, and must figure out how to get back to return without changing the time line.

title: Past Tense, Part II
desc: Sisko is forced to take the place of a key historical figure on Earth in 2024 in order to preserve the timeline.

title: Life Support
desc: Dr. Bashir must use extraordinary measures to prolong Vedek Bareil's life long enough to allow Bareil to complete sensitive peace negotiations between the Bajorans and the Cardassians.

title: Heart of Stone
desc: After chasing a fugitive into a cave, Kira gets stuck and is slowly encapsulated by a growing crystal stone while Odo tries to figure out how to free her.

title: Destiny
desc: Sisko faces a conflict between his Starfleet duties and his role as the Bajoran Emissary when an ancient Bajoran prophecy predicts a joint Federation-Cardassian project will lead to the destruction of the wormhole.

title: Prophet Motive
desc: Grand Nagus Zek is acting bizarre by giving away money and rewriting the Rules of Acquisition. Quark attempts to get the old Nagus back.

title: Visionary
desc: While a Romulan delegation tries to get information about the Dominion, O'Brien gets visions of unpleasant things that are about to happen in the future.

title: Distant Voices
desc: After being attacked in the infirmary, Dr. Bashir has a dual mystery on his hands: what has happened to the station while he was out and why is he aging so rapidly now?

title: Through the Looking Glass
desc: Sisko is kidnapped and forced to impersonate his deceased mirror universe counterpart in order to convince Jennifer Sisko to defect to the Terran Rebellion.

title: Improbable Cause
desc: After an attempt is made on Garak's life, Odo conducts the investigation on who tried to murder the Cardassian tailor - and why.

title: The Die Is Cast
desc: Now rejoined with his former mentor, Garak is ordered to interrogate Odo about the secrets of his people, while the joined Romulan/Cardassian attack fleet moves towards the Founders' home world on a mission of destruction.

title: Explorers
desc: Sisko rebuilds an ancient Bajoran space vessel from the blueprints, and he and Jake take the ship on a trip, attempting to prove that the ancient Bajorans went beyond their solar system without warp drive.

title: Family Business
desc: Quark and Rom return to the Ferengi home world because their mother has broken the law - by wearing clothes and earning profits, forbidden for women in Ferengi society.

title: Shakaar
desc: News arrives that Kai Winn has also become Bajor's political leader. She asks Kira to negotiate with an old resistance friend about returning soil reclamators.

title: Facets
desc: Dax asks the crew to join her Zhian'tara ritual. The memories of her former hosts will take over their bodies. Nog is preparing for Starfleet Academy.

title: The Adversary
desc: The Defiant is off to show the Federation's presence to the new Tzenkethi government. While underway the ship malfunctions and repeated instances leads Sisko to believe a changeling's onboard, engaging in sabotage.

title: The Way of the Warrior
desc: Sisko becomes uncomfortable when the Klingons station a task force to help defend against the Dominion. Worf is summoned to find out their true intentions.

title: The Visitor
desc: Melanie, an aspiring writer, wants to know why Jake Sisko stopped writing at 40. Jake tells how his father died in an accident and then suddenly reappeared.

title: Hippocratic Oath
desc: Bashir is asked to help a group of renegade Jem'Hadar break their addiction to ketracel white. Meanwhile Worf is dissatisfied with the way Odo runs security.

title: Indiscretion
desc: Kira and Gul Dukat go after the lost prison ship Ravinok. Dukat has a secret. Meanwhile Kasidy Yates tries to find work near Bajor, leaving Sisko uncomfortable.

title: Rejoined
desc: Lenara Kahn, the new host of the wife of Dax's former host Torias, comes to the station. While they're not allowed to renew their relation, there's still a spark.

title: Starship Down
desc: A damaged Defiant must play a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse with two Jem'Hadar ships inside a gas giant.

title: Little Green Men
desc: Quark and Rom take Nog to Earth and Starfleet Academy, but a malfunction with the ship takes the crew back in time, to Roswell, New Mexico in 1947.

title: The Sword of Kahless
desc: Worf, Dax and the Klingon Dahar master Kor set out to find an ancient lost relic: the Sword of Kahless.

title: Our Man Bashir
desc: When a transporter emergency turns the command crew into holosuite characters, Bashir's James Bond fantasy takes on a deadly reality.

title: Homefront
desc: Sisko travels to Earth when a bombing at a Federation conference is determined to be the work of Changelings.

title: Paradise Lost
desc: When Starfleet institutes martial law to combat the Changeling Menace, Sisko begins to question if the Dominion is the real threat.

title: Crossfire
desc: First Minister Shakaar visits the station, despite a threat of assassination. He falls in love with Kira much to Odo's dismay.

title: Return to Grace
desc: Dukat returns, stripped of his prestige, to escort Kira to a Cardassian conference about the Dominion. But an attack by a Klingon raider may give Dukat a chance to redeem himself in the eyes of his government.

title: Sons of Mogh
desc: Worf's brother Kurn asks him to perform a death rite to regain his lost honor. Meanwhile, Kira and O'Brien investigate Klingon activity near the Bajoran border.

title: Bar Association
desc: Unfair working conditions and pay cuts cause Rom to organize a union of the employees of Quark's Bar. Meanwhile, Worf still finds it hard to settle on the station.

title: Accession
desc: A man claiming to be the emissary comes through the wormhole. Sisko is happy to give up his position. Meanwhile Keiko returns and O'Brien stops spending time with Bashir.

title: Rules of Engagement
desc: When Worf destroys a civilian shuttle during an engagement with the Klingons, an extradition hearing is held to see if he must face charges.

title: Hard Time
desc: O'Brien tries to re-integrate to life on the station after serving 20 years in a virtual prison.

title: Shattered Mirror
desc: When the Mirror Universe counterpart of Sisko's deceased wife lures Jake to the other side, Sisko must follow and help the Terran resistance against the Alliance forces.

title: The Muse
desc: A mysterious woman approaches Jake about his future as a writer. Odo promises to do whatever it takes to help Lwaxana Troi keep her baby over the father's wishes - even if it means marrying her himself.

title: For the Cause
desc: Sisko must face betrayal when evidence surfaces that Kasidy is smuggling for the Maquis. Meanwhile Garak makes acquaintance with Ziyal.

title: To the Death
desc: A renegade group of Jem'Hadar plunders Deep Space Nine. Sisko agrees to a combat operation with loyal Jem'Hadar to prevent the renegades completing a planetary gateway.

title: The Quickening
desc: Bashir tries to help a planet in the grips of a Dominion-engineered plague that guarantees a painful death.

title: Body Parts
desc: Quarks hears on Ferenginar he is going to die. Rom convinces him to sell his remains. After an accident, Bashir has to move Keiko's baby to Kira's womb.

title: Broken Link
desc: Odo is suddenly struck by illness. He is barely able to hold shape. Bashir and Odo see no other alternative than going to the Founders. Garak wants to come along.

title: Apocalypse Rising
desc: With the war between Klingons and Federation intensifying, Sisko must make a plan to expose Gowron as a changeling. Odo is still having trouble with becoming a solid.

title: The Ship
desc: The crew is forced to retreat in a crashed Jem'Hadar ship after an attack by the Jem'Hadar. They get the feeling there's something very important about this ship.

title: Looking for Par'Mach in All the Wrong Places
desc: While Worf helps Quark to pursue his former wife Grilka, O'Brien and Kira grow uncomfortably close to each other.

title: Nor the Battle to the Strong
desc: Jake, reporting from the front lines, sees what war truly is.

title: The Assignment
desc: An alien entity has possessed Keiko's body and is holding it hostage until O'Brien completes an assignment for it.

title: Trials and Tribble-ations
desc: Sisko tells two men from Temporal Investigations how he and his crew went back in time to when Captain James Kirk of the first Starship Enterprise exposed a Klingon spy with the help of Tribbles.

title: Let He Who Is without Sin...
desc: While vacationing on Risa, Worf and Dax meet a group of fundamentalist protesters who claim that the Federation has gone soft.

title: Things Past
desc: Sisko, Dax, Odo and Garak find themselves in the past when the Cardassians controlled the station, and a crime that Odo investigated may be the key.

title: The Ascent
desc: When Odo and Quark crash land, they must put aside their differences to climb a mountain to signal for help. Jake and Nog try to be roommates, but their different styles clash.

title: Rapture
desc: Sisko begins having visions that may show him how to best help Bajor, but they're killing him.

title: The Darkness and the Light
desc: A mysterious assassin begins wiping out all the members of Kira's old resistance cell.

title: The Begotten
desc: The discovery of an infant Changeling gives Odo a chance to correct what he sees as the "mistakes" in his upbringing. But as Starfleet's pressure for results grows, he has to turn to his "father," Dr. Mora.

title: For the Uniform
desc: When the traitorous Eddington returns, Sisko will go to any lengths to capture him.

title: In Purgatory's Shadow
desc: A coded message from the Gamma Quadrant leads Garak to believe his mentor, Enabran Tain, is still alive. He and Worf seek him out, only to discover something much worse: a Dominion invasion fleet poised to attack the Alpha Quadrant.

title: By Inferno's Light
desc: The station readies for a Dominion attack. Worf and Garak meet some unexpected friends in a Dominion Prison camp.

title: Doctor Bashir, I Presume
desc: Dr. Bashir is selected to be the model for the next-generation of Emergency Medical Hologram (EMH). But he balks when his parents are invited to the station to be interviewed by the EMH programmer, Dr. Zimmerman. There is a dark secret in his family that he's afraid that his parents will reveal.

title: A Simple Investigation
desc: Odo (Rene Auberjonois) becomes romantically attached to a woman (Dey Young) working with the Orion Syndicate.

title: Business as Usual
desc: Quark must wrestle with his conscience when he becomes involved with arms merchants.

title: Ties of Blood and Water
desc: When a Cardassian official (Lawrence Pressman), who thinks of Kira (Nana Visitor) as his daughter, is dying, he agrees to reveal all he knows to her. But the experience dredges up Kira's memories of her own father's (Thomas Kopache) death.

title: Ferengi Love Songs
desc: Quark doesn't know whether to be panicked or overjoyed when he learns that his mother is the new lover of the Grand Nagus.

title: Soldiers of the Empire
desc: Dax and Worf accompany Martok on his first command since being held by the Dominion. But the ship they are given hasn't seen victory in months and the crew is near mutinous.

title: Children of Time
desc: The DS9 crew discovers a small colony on a remote world that was originally populated by them 200 years earlier due to a time-travel accident with the Defiant. The current colonists lives depend on making sure that accident happens again, even though they've now forwarned the crew that it will happen. Each crew member needs to decide if they are willing to give up their lives on DS9 in order to preserve the history of the colony.

title: Blaze of Glory
desc: Driven to desperation by the Dominion, the Maquis launch a massive bio-weapons strike towards Cardassia. Sisko must trust the traitor Eddington to try to stop them.

title: Empok Nor
desc: While salvaging components from DS9's sister station, the crew run afoul of a "surprise" left behind by the Cardassians.

title: In the Cards
desc: Jake and Nog go through hell and high water, from participating in an auction to dealing with the Dominion, to receiving a Willie Mays baseball card, all in order to cheer up the war-fatigued Captain Sisko.

title: Call to Arms
desc: With the continuing battalions of Jem'Hadar entering the Alpha Quadrant in preparation for war, Sisko decides to mine the wormhole to prevent further troop movement. This provokes a confrontation between the Dominion and the Federation, forcing Sisko to abandon DS9.

title: A Time to Stand
desc: Borrowing a captured Jem'Hadar attack ship, Sisko and crew embark on a mission to destroy the hidden base where all of the ketracel-white is stored for the entire Alpha Quadrant.

title: Rocks and Shoals
desc: Sisko and his crew crash on a barren world when their commandeered Jem'Hadar ship is shot down. They encounter Jem'Hadar who crashed there earlier, and have taken Nog and Garak hostage in exchange for medical aid for their Vorta overseer.

title: Sons and Daughters
desc: Serving with his recruit son aboard a Klingon vessel, Worf finds his relationship with his son strained. Meanwhile, strained relationships abound on DS9 between Major Kira and Gul Dukat.

title: Behind the Lines
desc: After forming an attack plan on the Dominion, Sisko relinquishes command of the Defiant to Dax after accepting a promotion. On DS9, the resistance faces discovery when Odo links with another changeling.

title: Favor the Bold
desc: Sisko mounts an attack to re-take DS9, while Rom faces charges as an enemy of the Dominion state.

title: Sacrifice of Angels
desc: The Federation attacks DS9 in hopes of keeping the mine field at the wormhole intact, while the Dominion waits entrance to the Alpha Quadrant from the other side.

title: You Are Cordially Invited
desc: Suddenly desiring to wed within the week on DS9, Worf and Jadzia go through their own Klingon rituals: Worf on a four day bachelor party with the male members of the crew & Jadzia deals with her prospective mother-in-law, who totally opposes the idea of "an alien" marrying into her Klingon household.

title: Resurrection
desc: Major Kira takes a romantic interest in the mirror universe counterpart of her deceased lover Bareil after he transports himself into her universe and onto DS9.

title: Statistical Probabilities
desc: A group of genetically engineered humans are brought to Dr. Bashir on DS9 in hopes of integrating them with the rest of the universe.

title: The Magnificent Ferengi
desc: At the request of the Grand Nagus, Quark puts together a mission to rescue Quark's mother, who is in the hands of the Dominion.

title: Waltz
desc: After being attacked by Cardassian forces, Sisko gets stranded with a very psychotic Gul Dukat, who was being transported to his trial. Meanwhile the crew of the Defiant races to rescue survivors.

title: Who Mourns for Morn?
desc: A former patron of Quark's bequeaths everything to him.

title: Far Beyond the Stars
desc: Captain Sisko has a full sensory vision of himself as an under-appreciated science fiction magazine writer in 1950s America.

title: One Little Ship
desc: A Dominion attack on the Defiant endangers Dax, Bashir and O'Brien aboard the runabout U.S.S. Rubicon as they enter an anomaly that shrinks them to a very minute size. Unfortunately, they were being held stable by the Defiant within a tractor beam, which was discontinued during the attack.

title: Honor Among Thieves
desc: Chief O'Brien goes undercover to infiltrate an Orion crime ring.

title: Change of Heart
desc: Worf and Jadzia travel to the badlands to procure some information on the Dominion from a traitorous Cardassian. Bashir wants to engage in a holo-suite spy simulation, but O'Brien prefers to brush up on his tongo game after watching Jadzia lose to Quark.

title: Wrongs Darker than Death or Night
desc: After receiving some disturbing information from Gul Dukat, Major Kira seeks Sisko's approval as Emissary to travel back in time to find out the truth about her mother.

title: Inquisition
desc: Dr. Bashir's plans to attend a medical conference at a breezy resort are canceled when Starfleet Intelligence boards DS9, suspecting the doctor of treason.

title: In the Pale Moonlight
desc: To save the Federation in a critical scheme, Sisko comes to realize that he must violate its fundamental principles to do so.

title: His Way
desc: Odo is schooled in the ways of romance by a holographic programmed lounge singer.

title: The Reckoning
desc: Spiritualists on Bajor summon Captain Sisko to the planet surface, where they show him a stone tablet with some unknown inscriptions. Once on DS9, the inscription reveals an ancient prophecy of coming disasters surrounding the wormhole, Bajor, and DS9, as those around him voice their uneasiness about Sisko being an Emissary for the planet.

title: Valiant
desc: Jake and Nog's runabout come under attack from the Jem'Hadar, and are rescued by the Valiant, a ship manned by Red Squad, an elite group of young Starfleet cadets.

title: Profit and Lace
desc: Quark's mother and the Grand Nagus show up on DS9, announcing a new amendment to the Bill of Opportunities he has instituted on the home planet of Ferenganar, and then follows up with the announcement, that, due to the new amendment, chaos has followed and he has been deposed.

title: Time's Orphan
desc: The Chief's daughter gets caught in a time displacement and when they get her back, she is considerably older.

title: The Sound of Her Voice
desc: As the Defiant races to a shipwrecked officer who is days away, the crew keeps in contact with her. Meanwhile, Jake follows Quark's latest scheme for story research.

title: Tears of the Prophets
desc: When Sisko is picked to head up an attack on the Cardassian homeworld, the Prophets appear to him in a vision, warning him of impending doom if he leaves the station.

title: Image in the Sand
desc: Having returned to Earth a couple of months ago, Sisko waits for the Prophets to instruct him on what to do next. When he receives one, he begins searching for the woman behind the face in the sand in his vision. Meanwhile, back on DS9, Kira deals with a promotion and handling the decisions surrounding her command, and finding herself wishing for the return of Sisko. And Worf deals with the loss of his wife, Jadzia Dax.

title: Shadows and Symbols
desc: Ezri Dax joins Sisko and his family on his quest for the Orb of the Emissary. Colonel Kira mounts a blockade around a Bajoran moon, where the Romulan hospital is - along with thousands of Romulan missles (claimed to be defensive in purpose). Quark joins Bashir & O'Brien as they join Worf, aboard a Klingon warship as they mount a dangerous mission in Jadzia Dax's name in an effort to get her spirit into Sto-vo-kor, the Klingon's heaven.

title: Afterimage
desc: Sisko tries to convince Ezri to stay in Starfleet and serve aboard DS9, as Ezri tries to get to know Jadzia's friends aboard the station, especially Worf. Meanwhile, Garak tries to deal with a severe bout of claustrophobia.

title: Take Me out to the Holosuite
desc: A Vulcan captain challenges Sisko to a game of baseball.

title: Chrysalis
desc: Dr. Bashir attempts to bring one of his genetically engineered friends out of the catatonic state she is in, and when he is successful, he begins to fall for her.

title: Treachery, Faith and the Great River
desc: A Vorta offers Odo valuable information on the Dominion in exchange for asylum. Meanwhile, Nog tries his Ferengi knowledge as he wheels and deals for a valuable piece of equipment for Chief O'Brien.

title: Once More Unto the Breach
desc: An aged Kor requests an opportunity to die with honor as a warrior.

title: The Siege of AR-558
desc: Capt. Sisko and his away team volunteer to stay with a besieged unit at an isolated outpost.

title: Covenant
desc: Kira is kidnapped and taken to Empok Nor by a member of a Pah'Wraith cult and discovers the group leader is Gul Dukat.

title: It's Only a Paper Moon
desc: Severely depressed at his serious war wound, Nog retreats into Vic Fontaine's holosuite program while the singer tries to help him.

title: Prodigal Daughter
desc: Ezri travels to her family home in search of Chief O'Brien who has discovered a murdered woman connected with the family and the Orion Syndicate.

title: The Emperor's New Cloak
desc: Quark and Rom have to rescue Grand Nagus Zek who's being held captive in the alternate universe.

title: Field of Fire
desc: To find an apparently untraceable murderer, Ezri Dax reluctantly calls up the residual consciousness remnant of her symbiont's past hidden psychopathic murderer host, Joran.

title: Chimera
desc: After searching out and finding Odo, another changeling asks him to leave DS9 with him, even though the rest of the crew aren't convinced the new changeling is not part of the Founders.

title: Badda-Bing, Badda-Bang
desc: When a programming glitch won't go away, mobsters take over Vic's and open for business, but the DS9 gang takes it personal when their favorite hangout is no longer their favorite, and they plan to get the new management ousted.

title: Inter Arma Enim Silent Leges
